newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: SLOVAK C.BANK PROPOSES MAGULA TO GOVERNING BOARD.
newsitem.headline: SLOVAK C.BANK PROPOSES MAGULA TO GOVERNING BOARD.

text.p: The National Bank of Slovakia (NBS) said on Tuesday it was proposing former deputy finance minister Jozef Magula as a new governing board member.
The government said earlier it would discuss the appointment of a new board member at its regular Tuesday session but gave no names.
"NBS Governor Vladimir Masar is presenting a proposal to add one new member to the bank board -- Jozef Magula," bank spokesman Ivan Paska told Reuters.

He added that Masar would propose another board member within 14 days and that soon afterwards the third vacant place on the eight-member board would be filled. He declined to say who the candidates were.
Local bankers have been watching for signs appointment of new board members by the government could reduce the NBS's independence and lead to a loosening of its tight monetary policy.

Leading government officials have repeatedly criticised the NBS's tight policy, which was further strengthened at the end of 1996 after the government approved a fiscal deficit of 3.7 percent of GDP for this year, compared with a 0.4 percent surplus in 1996.
